revised_title: Unified Atom Perturbation Theory for Short-Range Atomic Interactions
tldr: The authors present a new united atom perturbation theory for short-range atomic interactions. They introduce a similarity transformation of the Schrödinger equation that addresses the cusp conditions at both nuclei and maintains the correct molecular symmetry. The first-order theory is examined in detail and compared with other united atom theories, showing remarkable agreement for separations up to 1 bohr.
